content.description: Great climb up a featured, overhanging arete. Easy start to a stance below the prow. Find good features to make the second clip then make a big move to a jug. Pull past this to another stance and a tricky step left where you can clip the chains.
content.location: Far left side of Sunset Wall, past The Clam, before you reach the bolted boulder problems

content.description: High first bolt! Layback the finger crack until it widens to hands and use edges and fins on either side to reach the stance for clipping the first bolt. Work your way left (crack technique helps) and try to style the mantel. Move back right and swim up the featured slab.
content.protection: Bolts, anchor with chains. A cam placement is available for the run-out to the first bolt.
content.location: Left of the tree, in front of a boulder, first section of Sunset Wall

content.description: A stellar roof problem with killer moves! Shares the first bolt with The Metro, then go straight up
content.protection: Protected by 3 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: First bolt is under the large roof on the Sunset wall. The first bolt is shared with The Metro, then go straight for the roof

content.description: Fun roof climb. Some long reaches on big holds on steep terrain. After clipping the first bolt, step left, then go straight up to follow the path of least resistance through the roof. Shares the first bolt with  'Pleasure Victim'.
content.protection: Four bolts. Some folks might enjoy a stick clip. Chains on top.
content.location: Near the end of the Sunset wall.

content.description: Really fun for how short it is! Layback (and jam, if you can) up the rounded flake, getting a high foot to help through the crux. Continue up then step left, ducking under the overhang. Shimmy left and make an awkward clip of the chains.
content.location: Far left side of Sunset Wall, obvious rounded flake beneath an overhang

content.description: Start right in front of the tree, using the fin/crack on your right and face holds on your left. Fun sequence through the middle up to the roof, where you can get a creative rest. Easy slab finish.
content.location: First section of Sunset Wall, slightly uphill from the trail

content.description: Apparently you're supposed to climb up the right side of the bolt line. Maybe this is where the crux is. Otherwise climb the first two bolts of The Clam and make a fun, airy traverse right on sweet holds, which is easier.
content.location: Far left side of Sunset Wall, right of obvious Clam feature

content.description: Short route with decent holds. Its worth doing a lap if you're breaking into 5.10s. The rock at the start is less than perfect, but is more solid up top. Don't let the moss at the top intimidate you.
content.protection: 3 bolts. 2 Rap Hangers for the anchor
content.location: Starts left of the large roof of "the Metro". There's a large, flatish boulder at the base you can stand on for the start.

content.description: The crag at Rattlesnake requiring the longest walk. The Sunset Wall gets the most afternoon sun of any crag at Rattlesnake. A great place to climb in the winter, if you can get there. There are also some boulders down the hill from this wall.
